September 3, 1927.

721743f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Bayard Street
721743f-a.text:
Noott Street, north from Chatham Square, showing the main,
thoroughfare thru that Manhattan locality known as ''Chinatown''.
Note the ornamental iron balconies and the oriental signs with
a total absence of obvious Asiatic individuals. View 2 is a
photostat copy of the oriminal.
About 1895.
Views 1 and 2
Eucene L. Armbruster
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

721755f.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Bayard Street
721755f.text:
Mott Street, south from a point between Bayard and Pell
Streets, and across the latter to Park Street. In the back-
ground, is the R. C. Church of the Transfiguration. Note the
non-oriental aspect of this locale. View 1 is the original,
View 2 a photostat positive.
About 1890
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED
721755f.folder: Mott Street & Bayard Street, Manhattan, NY

721759f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Bayard Street
721759f-a.text:
Mott Street  . north from, but not including Chatham Square,
to, but not including Bayard Street. Shown at the N.W. corner of Park
Street, is the R.C. Church of the Transfiguration.
About 1926.
Ewing Galloway.
No eproductions.
NV6G P 1R20
721759f-a.folder: Mott Street & Bayard Street, Manhattan, NY

721764f-a.title: Manhattan: Mott Street - Bayard Street
721764f-a.text:
Mott Street, west side, no th from, but not including Bayard, to and
including Canal 8treete.
About 1926.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
phe Federal Yriters' Project of the W.P.A. states on page 426
of its New York Panorama that No. 65 Mott Street has been occupied
since 1825 and gives as the authority for that statement, the 'Plumber
and Sanitary Engineer' of December 1879. This building sppears in the
center of this view, being the third structure from the left with fire
escapes thereupon. Note that the roofing cornice has been removed. The
tenements to this side of same are of the dumbbell type which originated
in 1879 subsequent to the repeal in 1872 of the first tenement housing
law of 1867.
